definition: to yield to one another/mutual accommodation
mutual
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: Third, , uphold mutual understanding and mutual accommodation and peaceful settlement of disputes through dialogue and consultation.
sentences.chinese: 第三，互谅互让，坚持对话协商和平解决争议。

sentences.english: You need a give-and-take attitude to get along in this firm.
sentences.chinese: 要想在这个公司和同事处好，你需采取谅互让的态度。

sentences.english: We can only settle this argument if there is a little give and take on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 只有双方互谅互让这个争论才能解决。

sentences.english: Advocacy of the spirit of mutual understanding and mutual accommodation among successors.
sentences.chinese: 提倡继承人之间互谅互让的精神。

sentences.english: Employers and employees should deal with this matter in the spirit of mutual understanding and accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 劳资双方要以互让互谅的态度处理有关问题。
需采取互谅互让的态度。

definition: to modestly decline
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
harmony is to be prized
respect the old and cherish the young
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
neighborly relations
peaceful relations/harmonious
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
Huzhu Tuzu autonomous county in Haidong prefecture 海東地區|海东地区[Hai3 dong1 di4 qu1], Qinghai
to help each other
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
to coexist/to get along (with others)
friendly affection/fraternal love
family-like close relationship (idiom)
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
pinyin: hua4 gan1 ge1 wei2 yu4 bo2
